feed.title: Google Cloud: Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware 1.31.1200-gke.60 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade a cluster. Google Distributed Cloud 1.31.1200-gke.60 runs on Kubernetes v1.31.13-gke.1100.

If you are using a third-party storage vendor, check the GDC Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for use with GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.
entry.summary: The latest software-only version of Google Distributed Cloud for VMware, 1.31.1200-gke.60, is now available for download. This release runs on Kubernetes v1.31.13-gke.1100 and includes important updates. Ensure your third-party storage vendor is qualified for this release before upgrading. Please note that new versions may take 7-14 days to become available through GKE On-Prem API clients.
entry.title: Announcement: New Software Version Released

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.34.0-gke.566:

  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: This release resolves security vulnerabilities. For a detailed list of fixed issues, please refer to the documentation on vulnerability fixes.
entry.title: Fixed: Vulnerabilities addressed

entry.content:
• Upgraded containerd from 1.7 to 2.0.
  • Registry mirror configuration information has been migrated to the hosts.toml containerd config file.
  • Upgrade preflight checks now validate PodDisruptionBudgets.
entry.summary: Containerd has been upgraded to version 2.0. This includes migrating registry mirror configurations to hosts.toml and enhancing preflight checks to validate PodDisruptionBudgets.
entry.title: Change: Containerd 2.0 Upgrade Complete

entry.content:
Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware 1.34.0-gke.566 is now available for download. To upgrade, see Upgrade a cluster. Google Distributed Cloud 1.34.0-gke.566 runs on Kubernetes v1.34.1-gke.2900.

If you are using a third-party storage vendor, check the GDC Ready storage partners document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release.

After a release, it takes approximately 7 to 14 days for the version to become available for use with GKE On-Prem API clients: the Google Cloud console, the gcloud CLI, and Terraform.
entry.summary: The latest version of Google Distributed Cloud for VMware, 1.34.0-gke.566, is now available for download and upgrade. This release runs on Kubernetes v1.34.1-gke.2900. Please ensure your third-party storage is compatible before upgrading.
entry.title: Announcement: New release of VMware software available

entry.content: Changed the upgrade logic for non-advanced clusters. When you upgrade a non-advanced cluster from version 1.33 to 1.34, the cluster is automatically converted to an advanced cluster. If you use custom code that depends on the non-advanced cluster configuration, this can be a breaking change. For more information, see Key differences after moving to advanced clusters.
entry.summary: Upgrading non-advanced clusters from 1.33 to 1.34 will now automatically convert them to advanced clusters. This change might affect custom code relying on the previous configuration. Review the documentation for details on advanced cluster differences.
entry.title: Breaking: Upgrade logic change for non-advanced clusters

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.33.300-gke.60:

entry.title: Fixed: Security vulnerabilities fixed

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.33.200-gke.70:

  • Fixed an issue that gkectl update blocks updating a non-HA non-advanced cluster to HA advanced cluster
  • Fixed vulnerabilities listed in Vulnerability fixes.
entry.summary: Resolved an issue where `gkectl update` prevented non-HA to HA advanced cluster updates. Additionally, addressed vulnerabilities mentioned in the security fixes documentation.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed cluster update issue

entry.title: Announcement: Google Distributed Cloud for VMware 1.33.0-gke.799 Released

entry.content:
• GA: Changed the cluster creation process so that all new clusters are advanced clusters. Additionally, all cluster upgrades to 1.33 are automatically converted to advanced clusters.
  • Upgraded the etcd component to version 3.4.33.
entry.summary: All new clusters are advanced clusters. Upgrades to 1.33 are automatically converted to advanced clusters. The etcd component has been upgraded to version 3.4.33.
entry.title: Changed: New advanced clusters

entry.content:
• GA: Enabled the vsphere-metrics-exporter component for advanced clusters. This exporter provides greater visibility into the VMware vSphere environment by collecting key performance and health metrics.
  • GA: Added support for VM-Host affinity groups in advanced clusters. This feature allows for the creation of rules that constrain cluster nodes to run on specific, predefined groups of hosts.
  • GA: Added support for automatic node resizing in advanced clusters. This feature optimizes resource use by automatically adjusting the CPU and memory allocated to control plane nodes in response to workload demands.
  • Public Preview: Added support for Virtual Machine (VM) tracking using vSphere tags in advanced clusters. This feature simplifies resource management by automatically applying identifying tags to cluster VMs.
  • GA: Introduced an Envoy proxy sidecar to the GKE Identity Service for clusters that use Controlplane V2. This change enhances the security, reliability, and performance of the authentication service.
entry.summary: Advanced clusters now support VM-Host affinity, automatic node resizing, and the vsphere-metrics-exporter for better VMware visibility. VM tracking with vSphere tags is in public preview. Envoy proxy enhances GKE Identity Service security.
entry.title: Feature: New features for advanced clusters

entry.content:
The following issues were fixed in 1.33.0-gke.799:

entry.title: Fixed: Fixed vulnerabilities

entry.content: For clusters configured with advanced clusters, introduced an Envoy sidecar into the GKE Identity Service to increase security, reliability, and performance.
entry.summary: The GKE Identity Service for advanced clusters now includes an Envoy sidecar to enhance security, reliability, and performance.
entry.title: Changed: GKE Identity Service Security Update
